H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5099.def: = action by which an animal makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H1566.def: = meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which humans suddenly become very angry and get engaged in a conflict

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H2779.def: = cold season of the year; also time of plowing; opposite of {L:קַיִץ<SDBH:קַיִץ>}; ≈ sometimes associated with hard work

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1802.def: = causative action by which someone draws water from a well using a receptacle attached to a rope

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H529.def: = state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2135.def: = state in which someone is considered as upright and innocent in character and behavior

H2891.def: = process by which an area or object becomes free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H374.def: = a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 {L:omer<SDBH:עֹמֶר>}

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H4611.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H6491.def: literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3366.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H6156.def: = state in which food tastes well and is considered desirable food; can be extended to refer to other things besides food

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H2687.def: = coarse sand or little stones; ≈ associated with low status; also sometimes found in food and therefore denoting an unexpected negative experience

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H1846.def: = process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H973.def: = state in which someone experiences a strong dislike and lack of respect for someone else

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H3976.def: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

H4703.def: literally: (one's) steps; hence: = one's journey through life with all the decisions that are taken, either for good or for bad

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3216.def: = action by which humans speak without proper reflection ahead of time

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1239.def: = action by which someone carefully focuses his/her eyes on a group of objects in order to locate something specific among them

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H212.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground, and occasionally for other purposes, such as threshing grain

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2664.def: = action by which humans carefully examine a place in order to find people or objects located in it or in order to gain information about it

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H2250.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by sickness or aggression; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances

H6482.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by accident or aggression; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances

H4838.def: = causative action by which someone removes dirt from an object by rubbing it vigorously with a piece of cloth or something else

H4347.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
